body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug

**What happened**:
`sudo kubeadm init --service-cidr 10.87.116.64/26` fails with error 
`could not parse dns ip "<nil>": <nil>`

**What you expected to happen**:
As 10.87.116.64/26 is a valid subnet CIDR, expected it have a valid dnsIP for example (10.87.116.73)

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Execute `kubeadm init --service-cidr 10.87.116.64/26` service CIDR could be any CIDR which does not end with zero 


**Anything else we need to know?**:
Complete output of the command
```bash
ubuntu@k8s-node-0:~$ sudo kubeadm init --service-cidr 10.87.116.64/26
[kubeadm] WARNING: kubeadm is in beta, please do not use it for production clusters.
[init] Using Kubernetes version: v1.7.5
[init] Using Authorization modes: [Node RBAC]
[preflight] Running pre-flight checks
[certificates] Generated CA certificate and key.
[certificates] Generated API server certificate and key.
[certificates] API Server serving cert is signed for DNS names [k8s-node-0 kubernetes kubernetes.default kubernetes.default.svc kubernetes.default.svc.cluster.local] and IPs [10.87.116.65 10.87.65.240]
[certificates] Generated API server kubelet client certificate and key.
[certificates] Generated service account token signing key and public key.
[certificates] Generated front-proxy CA certificate and key.
[certificates] Generated front-proxy client certificate and key.
[certificates] Valid certificates and keys now exist in "/etc/kubernetes/pki"
[kubeconfig] Wrote KubeConfig file to disk: "/etc/kubernetes/admin.conf"
[kubeconfig] Wrote KubeConfig file to disk: "/etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf"
[kubeconfig] Wrote KubeConfig file to disk: "/etc/kubernetes/controller-manager.conf"
[kubeconfig] Wrote KubeConfig file to disk: "/etc/kubernetes/scheduler.conf"
[apiclient] Created API client, waiting for the control plane to become ready
[apiclient] All control plane components are healthy after 43.502520 seconds
[token] Using token: 605d99.2604b2cc714dc063
[apiconfig] Created RBAC rules
could not parse dns ip "<nil>": <nil>
```

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.7.0
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: x86_64 server
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux k8s-node-0 4.4.0-92-generic #115-Ubuntu SMP Thu Aug 10 09:04:33 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools: kubeadm


CC @kubernetes/sig-cluster-lifecycle-misc

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Cluster Lifecycle.
labels.name: sig/cluster-lifecycle

title: kubeadm init fails if service CIDR range ends with a non-zero IP
